citation.article-title: Phytohabitans suffuscus gen. nov., sp. nov., an actinomycete of the family Micromonosporaceae isolated from plant roots
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Phytohabitans (Phy.to.ha′bi.tans. Gr. n. phyton plant; L. part. adj. habitans inhabiting; N. L. part. adj. used as a masc. n. Phytohabitans plant-inhabiting, isolated from plants).
Vegetative mycelia are branched and not fragmented.
Cell wall contains d-glutamic acid, glycine, d-alanine, meso-diaminopimelic acid and l-lysine.
Whole-cell sugars are galactose, glucose, mannose, ribose and xylose.
The acyl type of the peptidoglycan is glycolyl.
Phosphatidylethanolamine is detected, corresponding to phospholipid type II.
Predominant menaquinones are MK-9(H6), MK-10(H4) and MK-10(H6).
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 73 mol%.
The type species is Phytohabitans suffuscus.
